DOC.brief_summary: This study is a retrospective chart review of the use of subcutaneous IgG (SCIG) in infants less than two years old.
DOC.brief_title: Retrospective Chart Review of Subcutaneous IgG Use in Infants
DOC.criteria: Infants who received more than one dose of IgG by the subcutaneous route before the age of two years. Consent of parent/guardian if required by institution/IRB. Infants with protein losing conditions such as lymphangiectasis, nephrosis, S/P cardiothoracic surgery requiring drainage tubes for more than 48 hrs, protein losing enteropathy. Concomitant treatment with plasma, other blood products or IGIV while on SCIG. Lack of consent by parent/guardian (if required by Institution/IRB). Any other condition or treatment which, in the opinion of the local investigator, would interfere with obtaining valid results for that subject.
